intro: Caulokaempferia kayinensis, commonly known as the Kayin mountain ginger, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and related plants. The plant is characterized by its ornamental foliage, featuring broad, lance-shaped leaves with a glossy surface. It produces fragrant, orange-red inflorescences that bloom during the rainy season. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
